name: Granulomatous Lymphadenitis
chief_complaint: I have swollen lumps in my neck that won't go away and I feel tired all the time.

lab_results.Lymph node biopsy: caseating granulomas with Langhans giant cells

treatment: multi-drug anti-tubercular therapy (isoniazid, rifampin, pyrazinamide, ethambutol)
prognosis: Good with proper treatment, though therapy may last 6-9 months. Risk of recurrence if treatment incomplete.
description: A chronic inflammatory condition of lymph nodes characterized by formation of granulomas, most commonly caused by mycobacterial infection (tuberculosis). The granulomatous reaction represents a cell-mediated immune response to persistent antigens.
